properties.areaDesc: Ashe; Wythe; Watauga; Carroll; Grayson; Floyd; Alleghany
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 5 at 11:44PM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
A strong northwesterly jet will traverse the region overnight in
association with an upper-level disturbance passing across the
area. Winds aloft are quite strong and some of these winds are
mixing down to the surface in the higher terrain of southwest
Virginia and northwest North Carolina, especially from areas such
as Boone, to Jefferson, to Hillsville and adjacent areas along and
near the Blue Ridge.

Wind gusts as high as 45 to 50 mph will be possible in the higher
terrain across Watauga, Ashe, Grayson, Alleghany, Carroll, Floyd,
and Wythe counties through the early morning hours.

Motorists, especially those driving high profile vehicles, are
urged to drive with extreme caution. These strong winds will
impact the higher terrain through the Interstate 77 corridor from
just north of the North Carolina/Virginia border northward to
Wytheville. High profile vehicles should exercise extreme caution
traveling through this area and in fact may want to avoid travel
through this region until the winds subside after daybreak.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or Commercial Radio and
Television for the latest weather information.

NWSheadline: Strong and Gusty Northwest Winds Expected Overnight
